channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Witness Neighbour Flytip in Park, 16th June
item.description:
We saw a person take a white and green bag from their house next to the park and empty it over the fence into the green area (attached image). They then took the white and green bag back to their home. This was the first time we saw someone dump rubbish in the park but the park itself often has litter across it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Varcoe Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Four cones blocking the road, 16th June
item.description:
They seem out of place. Currently the cones are blocking the road completely, I see no reason why it's done officially. Can cause issues when cars try to U-turn out

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Heath Road, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Empty alcohol containers in gated area around Rochester House, 16th June
item.description:
Resident of flat 40 still struggles to grasp the concept of civilised living and keeps throwing rubbish from his window - mainly empty cans from beer, black off-license bags, tissues etc. Please clear it out and address it with the resident of flat 40. It’s just a question of time when it injures someone as it also regularly flies behind the fence on footpath around Tabard Gardens. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Manciple Street, The Borough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Left there in the evening

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 119, Chatham Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Anerley court fly tipping, 16th June
item.description:
Can I ask how we have gone from an enforced £2500 fine for fly tipping to a total unforced fly tipping culture along anerley park? In particular the large blocks of flats - anerley court and linden court? Our council tax has almost double in the last few years but the enforceability has seemingly dropped off a cliff. Please can you explain why these fines are not being imposed anymore and there appears to be a total disregard for local residents concerns?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Park, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 16th June
item.description:
Yet again dumped rubbish at recycling containers. Rubbish bags have been ripped open and spilling onto street. This is a constant issue and rubbish being dumped here pretty much every day
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Magpie Hall Lane, Bromley Common, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: More fly tipping 9 penge high street, 16th June
item.description:
You literally have the name of the person who is, on an almost daily basis, leaving rubbish on the pavement for the rest of us to walk around. Please can you explain what is being done about this individual?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, High Street, Penge, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike abandoned on our street, 16th June
item.description:
Someone left their broken bike on our street and has been here for a few weeks now. Please can somebody come to collect as it’s making out street look messy. It is also dangerous if it falls on somebody especially a child walking or running by. Thank you.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Finsbury Park Road, Hackney, London
